We have class name Client, docstring: "OpenID Connect is a layer on top of the OAuth2. See its specs at https://openid.net/connect/". Methods are helpers for token obtaining, building auth request URI, decoding ID token, initiating auth code flow, obtaining token via various flows (auth code flow, authorization code, browser). So class likely encapsulates OpenID Connect client responsibilities: constructing auth requests, handling token exchange, decoding ID tokens, supporting various flows (auth code, browser). Business intent: provide integration with OpenID Connect for authentication/authorization, enabling applications to obtain ID tokens and access tokens.

Keywords: OpenID Connect, OAuth2, token exchange, authorization code flow, ID token decoding, authentication, client, URI building, browser flow.

  "keywords": ["OpenID Connect", "OAuth2", "authentication", "authorization code flow", "token exchange", "ID token", "client library", "URI construction", "browser based login"]
